title: Ethereum ETF Race Gets Hotter As SEC Receives 11 Filings In One Week - NewsBTC
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

12 applications for Ethereum ETFs have been filed with the SEC in one week, with ProShares filing four.

ETFs would track Ether futures contracts, but the SEC has never approved an Ether futures ETF.

SEC Chair Gary Gensler has consistently refused to answer if ETH is considered a security.

If approved, ETFs will launch 75 days from filing.

Futures and spot ETF products differ in how they track the price of futures contracts vs. purchasing underlying assets.

Leading asset management companies, including BlackRock, are filing for spot Bitcoin ETFs in the US.

Investors and the crypto community await the SEC's decision, which may affect institutional investor access to crypto investments.

title: US Ethereum Futures ETF Has a 75% Chance of Approval in 2023 After Recent Flood of Applications, Analysts Estimate - The Daily Hodl
summary: US Ethereum Futures ETF has a 75% chance of approval in 2023 after a flood of applications, according to Bloomberg ETF analysts. The SEC has received 12 applications for Ethereum futures ETFs, leading to increased optimism for approval. The analysts predict the SEC will approve an Ethereum futures ETF in October, two years after the approval of the first Bitcoin futures ETF. However, no US Bitcoin spot ETF applications have been approved yet, and the SEC's decision on a June application from BlackRock is eagerly awaited.

title: Here's Why Arbitrum Became #1 Ethereum L2 Scaler: Opinion - U.Today
summary: Arbitrum, an Ethereum-based layer 2 (L2) scaler, has maintained its position as the largest L2 network by total value locked (TVL) due to its commitment to neutrality. The network has not endorsed any applications, allowing third-party teams to create their own protocols on the chain, fostering competition. This approach has contributed to Arbitrum's success, according to cryptocurrency researcher Patrick McCorry. Despite a recent surge in Optimism's (OP) metrics, Arbitrum remains the leader in the L2s segment, with a TVL of $5.93 billion and 56.16% of the total Ethereum L2s ecosystem.

title: How Cardano keeps dominating Ethereum despite price decline - AMBCrypto News
summary: Cardano (ADA) has maintained a strong development activity despite a 6% price decline last week. Data shows that Cardano's development activity is 3x higher than Ethereum (ETH). The latest update includes the Mithril mainnet upgrade, which aimed to reduce the time required for nodes to sync with the blockchain. The Cardano team has also been working on other projects, such as adding decentralized governance support and implementing Posthog analytics. The report also mentions that the number of projects building on ADA reached 1,271, while the number of projects launched touched 136. Despite the price drop, Cardano's whale transaction count remains high, and there is a possibility of a trend reversal in the coming days.

title: Ethereum Competitor Avalanche Sees Surge in Daily Transactions and Active Addresses in Second Quarter: Nansen - The Daily Hodl
summary: Avalanche, an Ethereum competitor, saw a surge in daily transactions and active addresses in Q2 2023, according to Nansen. The project's default smart contract blockchain, C-Chain, had between 200,000-550,000 daily transactions, nearly double the volume in Q1. The daily active address count also steadily increased, reaching a high of 117,304 on June 14th. However, the token's price dropped by nearly 27% during the quarter. Avalanche's TVL also decreased by nearly 20%.

title: This Week in Coins: Sparse News Extends Streak of Underwhelming Bitcoin and Ethereum Prices - Decrypt
summary: This week in cryptocurrency was marked by a lack of significant adoption or regulatory news, leading to a slow and underwhelming performance for leading cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum. The top altcoins also saw losses, with XRP and Solana falling by double-digit percentages. The only notable gain was made by Shiba Inu, which surged 14.7% after announcing a new identity protocol for increased security and privacy. Meanwhile, institutional investment in Bitcoin continued, with MicroStrategy reporting a $24 million Bitcoin impairment charge and Block reporting $2.4 billion of its Q2 net revenue coming from Bitcoin.

title: Learn To Find Once In a Lifetime Opportunities Like Bitcoin Spark and Ethereum - Analytics Insight
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Investors can find once-in-a-lifetime opportunities in upcoming ICO projects like Bitcoin Spark, which has potential for massive returns. Bitcoin Spark is a top Bitcoin hard fork ICO with great utility, solving shortcomings of the Bitcoin network such as high transaction fees and centralization in mining. The project utilizes a unique proof of process consensus mechanism and is on the verge of beginning its presale. Early adopters will receive a 20% bonus and can earn passive income through two revenue streams: lending processing power and advertisement income. For more information, visit the website or join the WhatsApp and Telegram community.

title: Ethereum Could See 50% Drop Against Bitcoin: Crypto Analyst Benjamin Cowen's Forecast - CryptoGlobe
summary: Prominent crypto analyst Benjamin Cowen predicts a potential 50% drop in Ethereum's value relative to Bitcoin. He believes a single event could trigger this drop, possibly a retracement in the stock market. Cowen points to a bearish double-top pattern on the monthly chart and historical tendencies of the ETH/BTC pair to decline from June to December. He suggests the pair could drop to 0.03-0.04 BTC, potentially marking the end of the altcoin reckoning. However, Cowen also cautions that the pair could experience further drops before finding a bottom.

title: Ethereum layer 2 scaling solution Base announces major onchain developments and initiatives - Cryptopolitan
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Base, an Ethereum L2 scaling solution backed by Coinbase, has announced major onchain developments and initiatives. The platform has opened bridging for selected Ethereum assets and will launch its mainnet on August 9, offering unrestricted access for developers. Base has also initiated "Onchain Summer," a month-long festival featuring 50 collaborators, including notable names such as Coca-Cola and Atari. Additionally, Base is providing 100 ETH in grants to prospective builders and creators through a collaboration with Prop House. These developments mark a significant milestone in Base's journey and poise it to become a prominent player in the Ethereum ecosystem.

title: New Hinman Documents and Ethereum’s Joe Lubin Raise Outrage from XRP Community - Crypto News Flash
summary: Newly released documents reveal that Joseph Lubin, co-founder of Ethereum, played a significant role in bringing William Hinman, former Director of Corporation Finance at the SEC, and Vitalik Buterin together before Hinman's speech on cryptocurrencies in 2018. This has sparked outrage within the XRP community, who claim that the speech was actually "The Ether Speech." The documents also show that Hinman had a meeting with Chris Lin, a partner at Simpson Thacher, despite advice on conflicts of interest rules. Empower Oversight, a watchdog group, has been leading the fight for more transparency at the SEC and has filed many requests and lawsuits under the Freedom of Information Act. The XRP community is questioning the double standards of the SEC and Hinman's involvement with Ethereum.
